(Associated Press) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR German Chancellor Angela Merkel and IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde wait for the arrival of President Donald Trump to the Gender Equality Advisory Council breakfast during the G-7 summit, Saturday, June 9, 2018, in La Malbaie, Quebec Canada. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci) (Associated Press) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR LA MALBAIE, Quebec (AP) â€” President Donald Trump arrived late for a gender equality meeting at an international summit, prompting Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to kick it off without waiting for "stragglers" to arrive. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Trump created a distraction when he walked in late for Saturday's breakfast meeting during the Group of Seven summit of leading industrialized nations being held in Quebec. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He missed Trudeau's introductory statement and entered the room while Gender Equality Advisory council co-chair Isabelle Hudon was speaking. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Security personnel had to open a path for Trump through a throng of journalists and cameramen. The camera clicks for Trump almost drowned out Hudon.
